{{Spanish name|De Narváez|Steuer}} {{Infobox officeholder | image = Francisco de Narvaez.jpg | caption = Francisco de Narváez in 2008 | birth_name = Francisco de Narváez | imagesize = 250px | birth_place = [[Bogotá]], [[Colombia]] | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1953|09|22|mf=yes}} | nationality = Argentinian | occupation = Entrepreneur and Politician | office1 = Member of the [[Argentine Chamber of Deputies]] | predecessor = [[Néstor Kirchner]] | term_start1 = June 28, 2009 | residence = [[Luján, Buenos Aires]], [[Argentina]] | net_worth = $500 million | boards = [[Grupo Clarín]] | spouse = Agustina Ayllón | website = [http://www.franciscodenarvaez.com Official website] }} '''Francisco de Narváez Steuer''' (born 22 September 1953 in [[Bogotá]]), known as '''El Colorado''' or '''Pancho''', is a [[Colombia]]n-born naturalized [[Argentine]] businessman, politician who ran for governor of [[Buenos Aires Province]] on the [[Republican Proposal|PRO]] ballot in the [[Argentine general election, 2007|2007 elections]] in [[Argentina]]. He is currently a member of the [[Argentine Chamber of Deputies]].
==Business life== De Narváez arrived in Argentina at the age of three. His father was a Colombian coffee merchant. His mother's family owned the [[Almacenes Tía]] chain of supermarkets, started by his grandfather, Karel Steuer, in [[Eastern Europe]] as 'Te-Ta'. Upon relocating to South America, it became a major chain. De Narváez began work there at the age of 17 years and was appointed Chief Executive in 1989, a position which he held for ten years.<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.franciscodenarvaez.com/conozcame_biografia.htm |title=Bio |accessdate=November 14, 2012}}</ref> De Narváez eventually sold the Argentinean division of the company in 2002<ref name=derf>{{cite news |url=http://www.derf.com.ar/despachos.asp?cod_des=50439 |date=November 27, 2005 |accessdate=November 14, 2012 |title=Francisco de Narváez: "Macri no cree en los partidos políticos tradicionales y yo sí" |publisher=Grupo Derf |author=Daniel Leñini}}</ref> for $638 million.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.perfil.com/contenidos/2007/05/13/noticia_0018.html |title=Francisco De Narváez: "No voy a votar a Kirchner" |date=May 13, 2007 |accessdate=November 14, 2012 |publisher=''[[Perfil]]''}}</ref>
In 2002, his group bought 50% of [[La Rural]], a major and historic exhibitions centre, and the additional 50% in 2005.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://edant.clarin.com/diario/2005/04/23/elpais/p-03001.htm |title=De Narváez, dueño de Rural SA |date=April 23, 2005 |accessdate=November 14, 2012}}</ref> In 2007 he bought one of Argentina's most important TV stations, [[América TV]]. He owns 20% of the ''[[El Cronista Comercial]]''.<ref>[http://www.seprin.com/portal/notas1/denarvaez.htm ¿Quién es Francisco de Narváez?] {{es icon}}</ref><ref>{{cite book |url=https://books.google.com/books?id=AAeFIS9OZrEC&pg=PA51&dq=Francisco+de+Narv%C3%A1ez&hl=en&sa=X&ei=VgGkUN-nLon02wXG0IGAAg&redir_esc=y#v=onepage&q=Francisco%20de%20Narv%C3%A1ez&f=false |title=Latin America 2012 46 Ed |author=Robert T. Buckman |page=56 |year=2012 |accessdate=November 14, 2012 |publisher=[[Rowman & Littlefield]]}}</ref> In 1983, de Narváez took Argentine citizenship to vote for [[Raúl Alfonsín]]. His nickname in business and politics is "El Colorado", and his personal fortune has been estimated to be in excess of $500 million.<ref name=FDNAR>{{cite news |url=http://edant.clarin.com/diario/2007/09/09/elpais/p-01495762.htm |date=September 9, 2007 |accessdate=November 14, 2012 |title=Francisco de Narváez: el millonario que saltó del PJ a candidato de Macri |publisher=''[[Clarín (Argentine newspaper)|Clarín]]''}}</ref>
==Political life== Following the 2001 crisis, he decided to enter politics and joined the [[Justicialist Party]]. He aided the presidential campaign of [[Carlos Menem]] in 2003 as a candidate for the position of Minister of Social Development.<ref name=derf /> De Narváez ran from the political left, commenting that in office he would be a staunch welfarist.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.pagina12.com.ar/diario/economia/2-73555-2006-09-26.html |title=El pragmático De Narváez se quedó con "El Cronista" |author=Raúl Dellatorre |publisher=''[[Página/12]]'' |date=September 26, 2006 |accessdate=November 14, 2012}}</ref> In July 2004 he then self-financed major commemorations around Argentina to celebrate the 30th anniversary of Peron's death.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.igooh.com/notas/biografia-de-francisco-de-narvaez-steuer-macri-varsvacki-y-el-consejo-judio-mundial/ |date=June 3, 2010 |accessdate=November 14, 2012 |title=BIOGRAFÍA DE FRANCISCO DE NARVÁEZ STEUER. MACRI, VARSVACKI Y EL CONSEJO JUDÍO MUNDIAL |author=De Narváez Steuer}}</ref>
Francisco de Narváez was elected as a National Deputy for Buenos Aires Province in 2005, the first foreigner to be elected to the Chamber. In 2006 de Narváez took the side of agriculture workers against the Argentinian government over efforts to either ban certain meat exports.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.agencianova.com/nota.asp?n=2006_12_8&id=36099&id_tiponota=4 |title=Francisco De Narváez: "El Gobierno recibió en Misiones un tsunami de votos" |date=December 8, 2006 |accessdate=November 14, 2012 |publisher=''Nova''}}</ref> He has also spoken out about the nationalization of private industry in many other areas of governance.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.diaadia.com.ar/content/francisco-de-narvaez-amanece-repartiendo-boletas |title=Francisco De Narváez amanece repartiendo boletas |date=June 26, 2009 |accessdate=November 14, 2012 |publisher=''Día a Día''}}</ref> [[File:De Narvaez at Gran Cuñado.jpg|thumb|left|Francisco de Narvaez appearance at [[Gran Cuñado]].]] As a centre-right pro business politician, he supported the senatorial bid of [[Hilda de Duhalde]] and sits with dissident [[Peronist]]s in Congress, opposed to the government of the [[Kirchnerism|Kirchners]].<ref>[http://www.noticias.uol.com.ar/edicion_1502/nota_00.htm Peronismo Ca$h] {{es icon}}</ref> He stood to be governor of the province in 2007, gaining over a million votes. Jorge Macri, cousin of [[Mauricio Macri]], was his running mate and their campaign was supported by Macri's party [[Commitment to Change]] and the [[Republican Proposal|PRO]] coalition. De Narváez mentioned to the press in November 2012 that he would be interested in forming a similar coalition in the upcoming 2013 election season as well.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1524285-de-narvaez-apoyara-una-eventual-candidatura-de-macri-en-la-provincia |title=De Narváez apoyará una eventual candidatura de Macri en la provincia |date=November 7, 2012 |accessdate=November 14, 2012 |publisher=''[[La Nación]]''}}</ref> During his campaigns, de Narváez is known for self-financing his campaigns, using his own money to pursue his political interests.<ref name=MFiore>{{cite news |url=http://www.losandes.com.ar/notas/2009/7/12/politica-434801.asp |title=Los negocios políticos y económicos de De Narváez en Mendoza |date=July 12, 2009 |accessdate=November 14, 2012 |author=Mario Fiore |publisher=''[[Los Andes (newspaper)|Los Andes]]''}}</ref>
On June 28, 2009, de Narváez defeated former president Nestór Kirchner in the legislative midterm elections in the province of Buenos Aires. During the electoral campaign he took part of the humoristic TV show [[Gran Cuñado]], which included parodies of the most important politicians of Argentina (including De Narváez himself), and engaged with his parody in stage jokes. This act generated controversy in the media about the effects on his actual electoral performance: columnists like Joaquín Morales Solá claim he was benefited from it,<ref>[http://m.lanacion.com.ar/nota.asp?nota_id=1141009 La sátira que desnuda un vacío de ideas] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110706081607/http://m.lanacion.com.ar/nota.asp?nota_id=1141009 |date=2011-07-06 }} {{es icon}}</ref> while other think that such influence was relative.<ref>[http://www.elargentino.com/nota-46584-Gran-Cunado-y-la-intencion-de-voto.html El efecto de Gran Cuñado sobre la intención de voto] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090627112321/http://www.elargentino.com/nota-46584-Gran-Cunado-y-la-intencion-de-voto.html |date=2009-06-27 }} {{es icon}}</ref> Francisco de Narváez says that Gran Cuñado helped him,<ref>[http://www.lu22radiotandil.com.ar/2009/07/25/de-narvaez-tengo-mas-plata-que-los-kirchner/ De Narváez: “Tengo más plata que los Kirchner”] {{es icon}}</ref> and that it helped to humanize the image of politicians.<ref>[http://www.lanacion.com.ar/nota.asp?nota_id=1135996 La visita de De Narváez a "Gran Cuñado", al ritmo del reggaeton] {{es icon}}</ref> He also ran the campaign in Buenos Aires as part of a political alliance between himself, [[Chief of Government of the City of Buenos Aires]] [[Mauricio Macri]] and former [[Governor of Buenos Aires]] [[Felipe Solá]].<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1098775-acuerdo-entre-sola-macri-y-narvaez-de-cara-a-octubre |title=Acuerdo entre Solá, Macri y Narváez de cara a octubre |date=February 11, 2009 |accessdate=November 14, 2012 |publisher=''[[La Nación]]''}}</ref>
In 2010 de Narváez introduced a bill to the Argentinian legislature to increase the universal child allowance from 180 pesos to 250. The bill was targeted at alleviating child poverty, and to correlate the allowance with wage inflation.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.lanueva.com/hoy/nota/edebb64bcc/1/68323.html |date=July 8, 2010 |accessdate=November 14, 2012 |title=Francisco De Narváez impulsa un proyecto para que la Asignación por Hijo pase a 250 pesos |publisher=Diario La Nueva Provincia}}</ref> In 2011 de Narváez ran for office with the UDESO as a gubernatorial candidate in the Buenoes Aires province.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.lanoticia1.com/noticia/elecciones-2011-de-narvaez-apunta-a-aglutinar-a-la-oposicion-20997.html |title=Elecciones 2011: De Narváez apunta a aglutinar a la oposición |date=October 3, 2011 |accessdate=April 25, 2013 |publisher=''La Noticia 1''}}</ref>
In October 2012 de Narváez began national calls for the formation of a new coalition to remove the majority coalition from power in Argentina, naming Peronist dissidents, the PRO, and others as potential members of a new ruling coalition.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.lacapital.com.ar/ed_impresa/2012/10/edicion_1452/contenidos/noticia_5451.html |title=De Narváez pide un frente de unidad nacional |date=October 27, 2012 |accessdate=November 14, 2012 |publisher=''Diario La Capital''}}</ref> He has been particularly critical of the national government in its handling of civil security and the country's problem with crime.<ref>{{cite news |title=La inseguridad es una realidad y un problema nacional |date=November 12, 2012 |accessdate=November 14, 2012 |url=http://www.minutouno.com/notas/267966-la-inseguridad-es-una-realidad-y-un-problema-nacional |publisher=''Minutouno''}}</ref>
==Personal life== His second wife is former model [[Agustina Ayllón]] with whom he has three children.<ref>[http://www.clarin.com/diario/2007/09/09/elpais/p-01495762.htm Francisco de Narváez: el millonario que saltó del PJ a candidato de Macri] {{es icon}}</ref>
==References== {{Reflist|2}}
==External links== {{commons category}} *[http://www.franciscodenarvaez.com Official website]

revision.text:
'''Functional management''' is the most common type of organizational [[management]]. The organization is grouped by areas of speciality within different functional areas (e.g., finance, marketing, and engineering). Some refer to a functional area as a "silo". Besides the heads of a firm's product and/or geographic units the company's top management team typically consists of several functional heads such as the chief financial officer, the chief operating officer, and the [[chief strategy officer]].<ref>[http://jom.sagepub.com/content/38/1/45.abstract Menz, M. 2012. Functional Top Management Team Members: A Review, Synthesis, and Research Agenda. Journal of Management, 38(1): 45-80.]</ref> Communication generally occurs within a single department. If information or project work is needed from another department, a request is transmitted up to the department head, who communicates the request to the other department head. Otherwise, communication stays within the department. Team members complete project work in addition to normal department work.
The main advantage of this type of organization is that each employee has only one manager, thus simplifying the [[command hierarchy|chain of command]].<ref>[http://www.pmhut.com/organization-structures-in-project-management Organization Structures in Project Management]</ref>
==See also== * ''[[Project Management Body of Knowledge|A Guide to the Project Management Body of Knowledge (PMBOK<sup>®</sup> Guide)]]'', Project Management Institute, {{ISBN|1-880410-23-0}} * [[Matrix management]]
==References== <references/>
{{DEFAULTSORT:Functional Management}} [[Category:Management by type]]

{{multiple issues|{{like resume|date=May 2017}} {{advert|date=May 2017}} {{Notability|Bio|reason=fails to meet [[WP:GNG]]|date=May 2017}} {{rough translation|1=Russian|listed=yes|date=May 2017}}{{citation style|date=October 2018}} }} {{Infobox person | name = Gennadiy Butkevych | birth_name = Gennadiy Vladyslavovych Butkevych | image = | imagesize = 250px | caption = |occupation = [[entrepreneur]] | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1958|5|27|df=y}} | birth_place = [[Dnipropetrovsk]], [[USSR]] | nationality = {{Flagicon|UKR}} [[Ukraine]] | death_date = | death_place = | death_cause = | known = | spouse = Valentyna Fedorivna Butkevych (Vlasova) | children = Anna, Daria | website = http://butkevich.com.ua/en/ |викисклад = }} '''Gennadiy Vladyslavovych Butkevych''' ({{lang-uk|Генадій Владиславович Буткевич}}) is a [[Ukrainians|Ukrainian]] entrepreneur and businessman. He is the co-owner of [[ATB-Market]].
== Biography == Butkevych was born on 27 May 1958 in [[Dnipropetrovsk]].
He graduated from the Dnipropetrovsk Engineer and Architecture Institute in 1980 and Oles Honchar Dnipropetrovsk National University and holds an MS degree in Engineering.
During Soviet rule, he worked as a police officer in the organised crime control department.<ref name="lb.ua">{{Cite web|accessdate = 2018-10-16|title = Буткевич Геннадий Владиславович|url = https://lb.ua/file/person/4343_butkevich_gennadiy_vladislavovich.html|publisher = lb.ua}}</ref>
== Business == In the 1990s, Butkevych joined the corporate sector.
In 1993, he became a co-owner of Agrotechbusiness trading company. He joined the company after Yaroslav Korchevskiy (ex-banker and mayor of Dneprodzerzhinsk) left it.
In 1995-1997, he ran the security service for Yuliya Tymoshenko’s [[United Energy Systems of Ukraine]] (UESU). [http://forbes.net.ua/magazine/forbes/1336454-pravdivaya-istoriya-atb-market]
In 1998, Butkevich, along with his partners Yevhen Yermak and Viktor Karachun, registered the ATB corporation (abbreviation for Agrotechbusiness).
Butkevych, Yermak, and Karachun are still equal-share co-owners of ATB.<ref>{{Cite web|accessdate = 2016-01-20|title = Правдивая история "АТБ-маркет"|url = http://forbes.net.ua/magazine/forbes/1336454-pravdivaya-istoriya-atb-market|publisher = Forbes.ua}}</ref>
ATB corporation works in such business sectors as assets management, retail, food production and sale, services in sports and recreation. The company employs more than 25 thousand people. The corporation owns one of the largest logistics hubs in Ukraine with goods turnover of over 70 thousand tonnes per month.
ATB chain of discount stores with the market share of 3.87% ranked second among TOP-5 retail chains of Ukraine, according to data of GT Partners Ukraine consultancy for 2010. In 2010, ATB ranked first by the number of points of sale (POS), in line with the Retail Chains Rating prepared by GT Partners Ukraine. The ATB-Market company entered the Top-500 of leading companies of the Central and Eastern Europe by total revenue for 2009, according to the report by Deloitte. Turnover of ATB retail chain for 2010 exceeded UAH 12.96 billion (incl. VAT), for 2011 — UAH 18.055 billion, for 2012 — about UAH 26 billion, for 2015 – turnover amounted to UAH 46.670 billion (incl. VAT).<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.atbmarket.com/about/o-kompanii/|title=АТБ|publisher=atbmarket|accessdate=2016-03-09}}</ref>
ATB corporation also includes [https://atb.ua/en_US/]:
* ATB-Market, Ltd. [http://www.atbmarket.com/en/about/] * Retail Development, Ltd. * Favorit Plus, meat plant [http://www.mffavorit.dp.ua/] * Kviten Confectionery Plant, Ltd. [http://kviten.com/] * Voskhod, sports club [http://skvoshod.com.ua/] * Equides, family type horse club (ExRoyalHorseClub) [http://equides.com.ua/nashi-akademisty/]
On 15 February 2018, Butkevych joined the Board of Directors at Trident Acquisitions Corp., a US-based company traded at NASDAQ stock exchange aimed at investing into oil and gas sector of Eastern Europe. Butkevych owns 10% of the company’s share and has the right to influence the selection of Ukrainian projects, in which the US company will invest.
== Financial state == Gennadiy Butkevych is listed on the list of the wealthiest citizens of Dnipropetrovsk.<ref>{{Cite web|accessdate = 2016-01-20|title = 20 богатейших днепропетровцев|url = http://forbes.net.ua/magazine/forbes/1348413-20-bogatejshih-dnepropetrovcev|publisher = Forbes.ua}}</ref>
In 2015, according to Forbes, his fortune amounted to $155 million (29th place in the ranking of TOP-100 wealthiest entrepreneurs of Ukraine and 29th place in the ranking of TOP-100 richest businessmen of Ukraine) <ref>{{Cite web|accessdate = 2016-01-20|title = 100 богатейших - 2015|url = http://forbes.net.ua/ratings/1.|publisher = Forbes.ua}}</ref>
== Hobbies == In 1998, Gennadii founded “Dnepr Open” amateur tennis tournament, which was organised for ten years in a row at the tennis courts of Voskhod sports club and was timed to Butkevych’s birthday.<ref>{{Cite web|accessdate = 2016-01-20|title = Любительские теннисные турниры "Dnepr Open"|url = http://tennisport.biz/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=96&Itemid=175|publisher = tennisport.biz}}</ref>
Being a votary of hunting, he leases out hunting lands (8,000 ha in area) in Ivanovsk district of Kyiv region.
== Family == Butkevych is married and has two children
His wife is Valentyna Fedorivna Butkevych (Vlasova), born in Dnipropetrovsk on 9 January 1958. She graduated from Dnipropetrovsk National University in 1980 — Faculty of Mechanics and Mathematics and is currently a housewife.
Their older daughter, Anna Butkevych, is a model and a private notary.{{refneeded|date=October 2018}}
Their younger daughter, Daria Butkevych, is a student who is engaged in equestrian sport. [http://equides.com.ua/nashi-akademisty/]
==References== {{Reflist}}
